column1: Lou Malnati's Pizzeria////I'm reviewing this chain based off of its whole "ship nationwide!" thing. I'm sorry
column2: but it makes zero sense. It costs just under $14 for a 9" pizza at the restaurant
column3: but it costs ... ... ... THIRTY bucks to get the SAME thing delivered to your house. Please explain to me how this is a good value? The $14 for 9" in Chicago is fair
column4: but under no circumstance is it okay or reasonable to charge as much as they do -- even if it includes shipping
column5: which it does. For that reason alone
column6: there's no way I can recommend ordering through the mail. It is the very epitome of a rip-off
